article.headline: Drexel 92, Hofstra 69
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Phil Goss was 6-for-6 from beyond the arc and scored 21 points as Drexel defeated Hofstra 92-69 on Wednesday. Five other Drexel players scored in double figures, led by Kenell Sanchez with 16. Sean Brooks had 14, Tim Whitworth scored 13, Bashir Mason 12, and Jeremiah King added 11 for the Dragons (15-7, 10-3 Colonial Athletic Association). Aurimas Kieza, Loren Stokes, and Gibran Washington all scored in double digits for Hofstra (10-13, 6-7), each tallying 18. Drexel jumped out to a 9-1 lead less than four minutes in and expanded the lead throughout the half, on the strength of 58 percent shooting from the field. The Pride cut the lead to 10 at the 7:12 mark, but Drexel closed the half on a 14-4 run to take a 42-22 lead at the break. The Dragons made sure Hofstra didn't get many second-chance looks in the opening stanza as the Dragons pulled down 21 defensive rebounds in the half. Drexel ballooned the lead to as many as 33, leading 65-32 at the 13:40 mark. And Hofstra was only able to pull as close as 19 the rest of the way.
